If it was omitted, use an empty object (`{}`)

If no second argument provided, try to serve the default view,

arguments.value: res.serverError() :: Could not locate view for error page (sending JSON instead).  Details:
arguments.raw: 'res.serverError() :: Could not locate view for error page (sending JSON instead).  Details: '

arguments.value: res.serverError() :: When attempting to render error page view, an error occured (sending JSON instead).  Details:
arguments.raw: 'res.serverError() :: When attempting to render error page view, an error occured (sending JSON instead).  Details: '

leadingComments.value: Otherwise, if this was a more serious error, log to the console
with the details.
Additionally: If the view was missing, ignore the error but provide
a verbose log.
If a view error occured, fall back to JSON(P).
If no second argument provided, try to serve the default view,
but fall back to sending JSON(P) if any errors occur.
If a view was provided in options, serve it.
Otherwise try to guess an appropriate view, or if that doesn't
work, just send JSON.

*
 * 500 (Server Error) Response
 *
 * Usage:
 * return res.serverError();
 * return res.serverError(err);
 * return res.serverError(err, 'some/specific/error/view');
 *
 * NOTE:
 * If something throws in a policy or controller, or an internal
 * error is encountered, Sails will call `res.serverError()`
 * automatically.

comments.value:
*
 * 500 (Server Error) Response
 *
 * Usage:
 * return res.serverError();
 * return res.serverError(err);
 * return res.serverError(err, 'some/specific/error/view');
 *
 * NOTE:
 * If something throws in a policy or controller, or an internal
 * error is encountered, Sails will call `res.serverError()`
 * automatically.
Get access to `req`, `res`, & `sails`
Set status code
Log error to console
Only include errors in response if application environment
is not set to 'production'.  In production, we shouldn't
send back any identifying information about errors.
If the user-agent wants JSON, always respond with JSON
If second argument is a string, we take that to mean it refers to a view.
If it was omitted, use an empty object (`{}`)
If a view was provided in options, serve it.
Otherwise try to guess an appropriate view, or if that doesn't
work, just send JSON.
If no second argument provided, try to serve the default view,
but fall back to sending JSON(P) if any errors occur.
If a view error occured, fall back to JSON(P).
Additionally: If the view was missing, ignore the error but provide
a verbose log.
Otherwise, if this was a more serious error, log to the console
with the details.
